creator: dherman7@earthlink.net
text: When I specify a custom doclet to the Javadoc task, the "author" and "version" tags get left out of the generated command line. First I called ant -verbose to verify that the options were not being generated in the Javadoc command-line when I enabled the use of my doclet. Since it wasn't generating the command-line correctly, I looked at the source code and found in Javadoc.execute() that the lines for generating those options only execute "if (author && doclet == null)" and "if (version && doclet == null)", respectively. Why is this done this way? Unless there is some other rationale for this that I'm missing, it seems to me to be a bug.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
It is done this way because these options are actually options of the standard 
doclet and not supported by every doclet.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/tooldocs/win32/javadoc.html#standard
